title: Meatball
data:
**[English]()** • [中文（中国大陆）‎](/wiki/Meatball/zh-CN "Meatball/zh-CN")

| % [![Meatball.png](/images/0/0d/Meatball.png)](/wiki/File:Meatball.png) |                                       |
| ----------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------- |
| Name                                                                    | meatball                              |
| Base price                                                              | 5 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")       |
| Nutrition                                                               | [5](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition")      |
| Turns to eat                                                            | 1                                     |
| Weight                                                                  | [1](/wiki/Weight "Weight")            |
| Conduct                                                                 | [meat](/wiki/Conduct#Vegan "Conduct") |

A **meatball** is a type of [comestible](/wiki/Comestible "Comestible") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. It is [fleshy](/wiki/Fleshy "Fleshy") and not [vegetarian](/wiki/Vegetarian "Vegetarian") or vegan.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Description](#Description)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 History](#History)
- [5 Variants](#Variants)
  - [5.1 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)
- [6 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

## Generation

Meatballs are not randomly generated, and can only be created by [zapping](/wiki/Zapping "Zapping") a [stone to flesh](/wiki/Stone_to_flesh "Stone to flesh") [spell](/wiki/Spell "Spell") at [rocks](/wiki/Rock "Rock"), valuable [gems](/wiki/Gems "Gems"), [gray stones](/wiki/Gray_stone "Gray stone"), or [statues](/wiki/Statue "Statue") that depict tiny-sized or non-fleshy monsters.

## Description

When [eaten](/wiki/Eaten "Eaten"), meatballs grant 5 base nutrition and take 1 turn to consume. Like [tripe rations](/wiki/Tripe_ration "Tripe ration"), meatballs are considered a [treat](/wiki/Treat "Treat") for [carnivorous](/wiki/Carnivorous "Carnivorous")[pets](/wiki/Pet "Pet"), and they can be thrown to tame carnivorous [domestic animals](/wiki/Domestic_animal "Domestic animal").

## Strategy

Meatballs are easily gathered by smashing [boulders](/wiki/Boulder "Boulder") and larger [statues](/wiki/Statue "Statue") and casting the spell of stone to flesh at the leftover rocks: [Healers](/wiki/Healer "Healer") always start with knowledge of the spell, and [Wizards](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") and [Priests](/wiki/Priest "Priest") can also start with the spell. As they provide little nutrition, the most direct use of meatballs for a [hero](/wiki/Hero "Hero") is to feed them to carnivorous pets, which is done to increase [apport](/wiki/Apport "Apport") for [stealing from shops](/wiki/Stealing_from_shops "Stealing from shops"), or else to maximize tameness if they plan on using a [polymorph trap](/wiki/Polymorph_trap "Polymorph trap") to turn it into an [inediate](/wiki/Inediate "Inediate") pet. They are also useful in a pinch for taming hostile domestic carnivores.

Meatballs make excellent [polyfodder](/wiki/Polyfodder "Polyfodder") for obtaining lightweight food such as [lembas wafers](/wiki/Lembas_wafer "Lembas wafer"), along with other uncommon comestibles such as [tins](/wiki/Tin "Tin") of [spinach](/wiki/Spinach "Spinach") and/or [tengu](/wiki/Tengu "Tengu") meat and [cockatrice](/wiki/Cockatrice "Cockatrice") [eggs](/wiki/Egg "Egg")—distribute them carefully in order to avoid accidentally creating a [flesh golem](/wiki/Flesh_golem "Flesh golem"). This can also be used to deliberately create flesh golems in order to try obtaining resistances from their [corpses](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse"), or else to tame one and turn it into a stronger [stone golem](/wiki/Stone_golem "Stone golem") using a cockatrice or their corpse.

## History

The meatball is introduced alongside the spell of stone to flesh in [NetHack 3.3.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.3.0 "NetHack 3.3.0").

## Variants

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), meatballs can be randomly generated, and can be sold in general [stores](/wiki/Store "Store") and delicatessens.

## Encyclopedia entry

Some hae meat and canna eat,  
And some would eat that want it;  
But we hae meat, and we can eat,  
Sae let the Lord be thankit.

\[ Grace Before Meat, by Robert Burns ]

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")
html:
Meatball

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 中文（中国大陆）‎
%
Name meatball
Base price 5 zm
Nutrition 5
Turns to eat 1
Weight 1
Conduct meat

A meatball is a type of comestible that appears in NetHack. It is fleshy and not vegetarian or vegan.

Contents

  • 1 Generation
  • 2 Description
  • 3 Strategy
  • 4 History
  • 5 Variants
    • 5.1 SlashTHEM
  • 6 Encyclopedia entry

Generation

Meatballs are not randomly generated, and can only be created by zapping a stone to flesh spell at rocks, valuable gems, gray stones, or statues that depict tiny-sized or non-fleshy monsters.

Description

When eaten, meatballs grant 5 base nutrition and take 1 turn to consume. Like tripe rations, meatballs are considered a treat for carnivorouspets, and they can be thrown to tame carnivorous domestic animals.

Strategy

Meatballs are easily gathered by smashing boulders and larger statues and casting the spell of stone to flesh at the leftover rocks: Healers always start with knowledge of the spell, and Wizards and Priests can also start with the spell. As they provide little nutrition, the most direct use of meatballs for a hero is to feed them to carnivorous pets, which is done to increase apport for stealing from shops, or else to maximize tameness if they plan on using a polymorph trap to turn it into an inediate pet. They are also useful in a pinch for taming hostile domestic carnivores.

Meatballs make excellent polyfodder for obtaining lightweight food such as lembas wafers, along with other uncommon comestibles such as tins of spinach and/or tengu meat and cockatrice eggs—distribute them carefully in order to avoid accidentally creating a flesh golem. This can also be used to deliberately create flesh golems in order to try obtaining resistances from their corpses, or else to tame one and turn it into a stronger stone golem using a cockatrice or their corpse.

History

The meatball is introduced alongside the spell of stone to flesh in NetHack 3.3.0.

Variants

SlashTHEM

In SlashTHEM, meatballs can be randomly generated, and can be sold in general stores and delicatessens.

Encyclopedia entry

Some hae meat and canna eat,
And some would eat that want it;
But we hae meat, and we can eat,
Sae let the Lord be thankit.

[ Grace Before Meat, by Robert Burns ]

A '''meatball'''  is a type of [[comestible]] that appears in ''[[NetHack]]''. It is [[fleshy]] and not [[vegetarian]] or vegan.

==Generation==
Meatballs are not randomly generated, and can only be created by [[zapping]] a [[stone to flesh]] [[spell]] at [[rock]]s, valuable [[gems]], [[gray stone]]s, or [[statue]]s that depict tiny-sized or non-fleshy monsters.

==Description==
When [[eaten]], meatballs grant 5 base nutrition and take 1 turn to consume. Like [[tripe ration]]s, meatballs are considered a [[treat]] for [[carnivorous]][[pet]]s, and they can be thrown to tame carnivorous [[domestic animal]]s.

==Strategy==
Meatballs are easily gathered by smashing [[boulder]]s and larger [[statue]]s and casting the spell of stone to flesh at the leftover rocks: [[Healer]]s always start with knowledge of the spell, and [[Wizard]]s and [[Priest]]s can also start with the spell. As they provide little nutrition, the most direct use of meatballs for a [[hero]] is to feed them to carnivorous pets, which is done to increase [[apport]] for [[stealing from shops]], or else to maximize tameness if they plan on using a [[polymorph trap]] to turn it into an [[inediate]] pet. They are also useful in a pinch for taming hostile domestic carnivores.

Meatballs make excellent [[polyfodder]] for obtaining lightweight food such as [[lembas wafer]]s, along with other uncommon comestibles such as [[tin]]s of [[spinach]] and/or [[tengu]] meat and [[cockatrice]] [[egg]]s—distribute them carefully in order to avoid accidentally creating a [[flesh golem]]. This can also be used to deliberately create flesh golems in order to try obtaining resistances from their [[corpse]]s, or else to tame one and turn it into a stronger [[stone golem]] using a cockatrice or their corpse.

==History==
The meatball is introduced alongside the spell of stone to flesh in [[NetHack 3.3.0]].

==Variants==
===SlashTHEM===
In [[SlashTHEM]], meatballs can be randomly generated, and can be sold in general [[store]]s and delicatessens.

==Encyclopedia entry==
